text.headline: More threatening calls
text.text: b'01/03/1983 - More threatening calls made to NALL.'

text.headline: 2nd Lesbian Community Meeting on threats to NALL
text.text: b"01/12/1982 - 2nd Lesbian Community Meeting on threats to NALL. Valley Women's Martial Arts Dojo, Thornes Mkt, Northampton"

text.headline: Written notes threatening NALL
text.text: b'01/13/1983 - Written notes, threatening NALL and coommunity as a group, left at Womonfyre Books. "The paper is right, homosexual people must be eradicated. S.H.U.N. - Stop homosexual Unity Now" and \'NALL will never exist, Gays must be persecuted". ("the paper" refers to an editorial by Joseph Sobran published in the Daily Hampshire Gazette which was viciously antigay).'

text.headline: 3rd Lesbian Community Meeting
text.text: b"01/20/1983 - 3rd Lesbian Community Meeting on threats to NALL and community, Valley Women's Martial Arts Dojo, Thornes Mkt, Northampton"

text.headline: Threataning phone calls made to NALL
text.text: b'12/08/1982 - Death threats to Bet Birdfish, NALL director.'

text.headline: Threatening phone calls
text.text: b'12/18/1982 - Threatening phone calls made to two lesbians in Northampton about NALL.'

text.headline: First Lesbian Community Meeting on threats to NALL
text.text: b'12/23/1982 - First Lesbian Community Meeting on threats to NALL and the community.'

text.text: b'A phone call to a lesbian by an unidentified male voice: "Whats going on in the meetings?"'

text.headline: "Old Lady Blue Jeans"
text.text: b'a reading by Elana Dykewomon for Lesbians and girl children only at SC'

text.headline: A threat is received
text.text: b'A threat is received on a tape machine at a local business threatening to kill, first to the coordinator of NALL, then to Kiriyo Spooner, and third to burn Womonfyre Books. The message is received on Saturday and they say that the store will be burned on Tuessday. The store is under 24 hour surveilance for the next 3 days, and for the 2 Tuesdays thereafter.'

text.text: b'A witch supply store opens at 56 Main St. in Northampton'

text.headline: Heramedia come to Northampton
text.text: b'Heramedia, Lesbian Video Project from NYC, comes to Northampton to film Lesbian & Gay Liberation March, victims of harassment (Kiriyo Spooner, Bet Birdfish, Kim Chistiansen) on location in Leeds at NALL & at Womonfyre Books for project on Lesbians & violence'

text.text: b'Industrial League - Orange Devils'

text.headline: GALA
text.text: b'inititates coalition to fight for a broad-based Anti-Discrimination ordinance in Northampton'

text.headline: Lesbian Union at UM loses its office space
text.text: b'is offered a small storage space instead. LU wages a successful fight for space resulting in an office in teh Student Union Building, UM'

text.headline: JEB visits Northampton
text.text: b'JEB visits Northampton, presents a slide show of lessbian photographs from mid-19th century to the present, reception at Womonfyre Books.'

text.headline: JEB - Lesbian Images in slide show
text.text: b'JEB- Lesbian Images in Photography Slide Show at Unitarian Church, Northampton  (also at MHC).'

text.headline: Jewish Lesbian Study Group forms
text.text: b'Jewish Lesbian Study Group forms and meets regularly through 1981.'

text.headline: Owners of Womonfyre Books, are threatened with vandalism and rape
text.text: b'Jil Krolik and Kiryo Spooner, owners of Womonfyre Books, are threatened with vandalism and rape by a group of 4 white men who invaded the bookstore.'

text.headline: Jil Krolik sets up a trap
text.text: b"Jil Krolik of Womonfyre Books sets up a trap for the phone harasser by heavily advertising a reading by Becky Births scheduled for August 5 at the store. The ads list Jills home phone as the information number. The District Attorney's office provides a telephone answering machine, and Jil stays at home to note the time of phone calls. Approximately 35 phone calls from a group of local kids are received. Three phone calls from SHUN are also received on July 30. Robert Kremensky is arrested August 5 for thos calls."

text.headline: Kate Clinton benefit performance
text.text: b"Kate Clinton, a feminist humorist gives a benefit performance for TRIVIA cosponsored by the Mount Holyoke Women's Center and TRIVIA"

text.headline: Kremensky is convicted
text.text: b"Kremensky is convicted of violating the civil rights of 3 lesbians and is sentenced to one year in jail (with all but 3 months suspended.) This is the first jail sentence under the state civil rights law for a violation of a gay person's civil rights."

text.headline: La Mix formed
text.text: b"La Mix formed, prior to this they had worked together without a name At Rahars for six weeks. La Mix started having women's dances at Hangar One."
